meanings.definition: To wrongfully take possession of someone's property.
meanings.sent1: The thief was disseizing the homeowner's belongings when caught red-handed.
meanings.sent2: The con artist was disseizing unsuspecting victims of their hard-earned money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon seemed to be disseizing the garden of its ripe fruits.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds disseizing the sky of sunlight foretold an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The greedy landlord was disseizing tenants of their security deposits unlawfully.

meanings.definition: To deprive someone of their legal right to property.
meanings.sent1: The corrupt official was disseizing citizens of their rightful land titles.
meanings.sent2: The unscrupulous businessman was disseizing investors of their shares in the company.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous siblings joked about disseizing each other of their favorite toys.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter winds seemed to be disseizing the trees of their last remaining leaves.
meanings.sent5: The unfair contract was disseizing the artist of their intellectual property rights.
